channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: There is renewed speculation of that the Reserve Bank might lower the cash rate into negative territory. Let's hope the RBA resists the urge.
item.title: No negative interest rates here please, Dr Lowe

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Research finds COVID-19 could be seasonal disease as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Nejc Kodric, who was Western United's team manager from June 2019 to December 2019, alleges Rudan's bullying caused him to suffer a mental illness and resign from his role.
item.title: Western United sued over Mark Rudan bullying allegations

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: George Floyd's death at the hands of Minneapolis police has sparked widespread riots in the United States with more than 40 cities in lockdown as demonstrators continue to clash with police.
item.title: George Floyd protests LIVE updates: Donald Trump threatens US military intervention as autopsy reveals Floyd's cause of death was 'asphyxiation from applied pressure'

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The boy, 7, and girl, 10, were travelling in the back seat of a grey Mazda 3 sedan travelling just south of Geraldton around midday on Monday.
item.title: Two young children dead in horror crash near Geraldton

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: More than 100,000 employees will be given up to $750 worth of Woolworths shares and a gift card to reward them for working over the coronavirus panic-buying period.
item.title: Woolworths rewards staff with over $50 million in shares, gift cards

item.description: The Wadjemup Project, named after the Noongar name for Rottnest Island, will honour almost 400 indigenous men and boys who were buried there in unmarked graves between 1838 and 1931.
item.title: WA's Rottnest Island indigenous prisoners remembered

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Victoria wants international students back soon, but Daniel Andrews warns that the tertiary sector must help with the quarantine effort.
item.title: Unis must help quarantine returning students, warns Premier

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: As the campaign for Eden-Monaro kicks off, Labor's candidate wants to see more done to help communities affected by the summer bushfires.
item.title: Labor candidate calls for tax deductible holidays to fire-affected areas

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Queensland's leading two-year-olds Rothfire and Isotope will jump from barriers 14 and 13 respectively after drawing out wide for the group 1 JJ Atkins.
item.title: Rothfire, Isotope to jump alongside each other in JJ Atkins

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Authorities are warning there may be a spike in cases next week, leading from relaxed social distancing measures that began on Monday.
item.title: Ten new coronavirus cases as authorities warn of spike to come

item.description: Formula One and Premier League clubs are expected to secure exemptions from UK quarantine rules by June 29 at the latest, with the government looking to expand the list of dispensations to include elite sport.
item.title: British grands prix to get green light

item.description: In 1924, the first successful experiment in wireless telephony between England and Australia was achieved, and with that, the final barrier of the isolation of Australia was removed.
item.title: From the Archives, 1924: The human voice transmitted from England to Australia

item.description: It's not just about police brutality. In the Minneapolis area, where protests have turned violent in the wake of the killing of George Floyd, the median income for black households is less than half of white ones.
item.title: Look at racial economic disparities to understand the riots, economists say

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 2, 2020

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Steven Miles said while he was sorry for adding to the family's grief, he would not have done anything differently given the man's positive test and flu symptoms.
item.title: Health Minister and Premier 'sorry' for Blackwater scare, but without regret

item.description: Andrew Weldon has been a contributor to The Age and The Sunday Age for many years. His cartoons have been published widely nationally and internationally, including in The New Yorker, The Spectator and Private Eye. He has published two book collections of his work and several childrens' books. He smells funny.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Weldon

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: Queensland's child safety department's handling of toddler Mason Jet Lee's case was a failure in nearly every way, a coroner says.
item.title: Coroner slams child safety department over death of Mason Lee

item.description: The seemingly insurmountable barriers to air travel have begun to look less daunting. Right now, the industry will take any good news it can get.
item.title: A desperate aviation industry is hoping the worst is over

item.description: Holden's commitment to the Supercars championship will formally end at the completion of the 2020 season.
item.title: Holden to leave Supercars at the end of 2020 season

item.description: Spike Lee has reimagined his 1989 film Do the Right Thing as part of the George Floyd protests.
item.title: 'People are fed up': Spike Lee releases short film

item.description: Trump's reckless accusations lack evidence, like many of his claims.
item.title: What is Antifa and why does Donald Trump want to blame it for the violence in the US?

item.dc:creator: Annie Brown
item.description: Tatler magazine's 'Catherine the Great' cover story has ruffled Palace feathers, but Kate Middleton (thanks to her sartorial prowess) is having the last laugh.
item.title: Tit for tat not Duchess of Cambridge's style

item.description: Warning that Victoria may see a spike in COVID-19 and other viruses next week.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: Staff have been told that Whimn.com.au will cease publishing at the end of the month.
item.title: News Corp axes women's masthead in latest round of cost-cutting

item.description: Nat Fyfe says Fremantle players' understanding of new coach Justin Longmuir's game plan has regressed as a result of the two-month AFL shutdown.
item.title: Shutdown a blow for Dockers game plan: Fyfe

item.description: In eight minutes in America, one man’s life went from 46 years to death but such tragedies are not unique to the United States.
item.title: What can a person do in eight minutes?

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: The US military has readied active-duty troops to potentially respond to protests over the death of an African-American man in police custody.
item.title: Trump threatens to deploy the US military against protesters

item.description: A 10-year-old boy will face court after leading police on a chase through the suburbs of Bunbury on Monday night.
item.title: Boy, 10, charged after South West police chase

item.description: USA protests spread across America and across the world after the death of George Floyd while in police custody in Minneapolis.
item.title: George Floyd protests go global

item.description: Curfews begin in US cities as a medical examiner classifies George Floyd's death as homicide.
item.title: Tablet interactive: US riots

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The Australian sharemarket has brushed off a weak start to climb by as much as 0.4 per cent, while the Aussie is hovering at near four months highs.
item.title: ASX shakes early losses, Aussie at near four-month highs

item.description: Some F1 drivers have followed Lewis Hamilton's lead after the world champion criticised his sport's silence over the killing of African American man George Floyd.
item.title: Hamilton's anger at F1's silence over racism

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Authorities confirmed on Monday night that further tests had cleared 30-year-old Nathan Turner of COVID-19, believed to be the nation's youngest virus fatality.
item.title: Calls for answers and apologies after central Queensland COVID-19 scare

item.description: Halfback Jamal Fogarty is adamant things aren't as dire as they seem at the Gold Coast club.
item.title: Titans can build winning culture: Fogarty

item.description: The prohibition order came less than a week after Chinese communist authorities in Beijing moved to enact new security laws on the former British colony.
item.title: Hong Kong bans Tiananmen vigil for first time, as Beijing tightens grip

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: A newly released survey shows almost 90 per cent of West Australians support interstate border closures – the highest level of support of any state as the number of active CVID-19 cases in WA rises to 29.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Most West Australians support state border closure as cases creep up again

item.description: Companies are under increasing scrutiny over how they are responding to the protests in the US.
item.title: 'Silence is not an option' for Corporate America during riots

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: As a young fair-skinned Aboriginal woman, Tanesha Bennell recognises her privilege and made it her mission to use that to her advantage in raising awareness to issues of systematic racism in Australia.
item.title: 'I was too light and too black': The teenager behind one of Perth's largest protests

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: The sound of thousands of people of all races and backgrounds chanting “black lives matter” and “no justice, no peace” echoed through Perth CBD on WA Day in a united stance against racism and police brutality.
item.title: 'Racism is real in Australia': Aboriginal deaths in custody in spotlight of Perth Black Lives Matter protest

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set for positive start on RBA day, $A rises

item.description: Stocks shook off a wobbly start on Wall Street and closed broadly higher, adding to the market’s recent run of solid gains.
item.title: Wall Street shakes off weak start to close higher

item.description: Obama argued that "the elected officials who matter most in reforming police departments and the criminal justice system work at the state and local levels".
item.title: Barack Obama speaks out on unrest, urges voters to focus on local races

item.description: This may turn out to be one of the best environments for investment bankers generally, but one Wall Street trading titan could be in a league of its own.
item.title: JPMorgan is flying high during the pandemic

item.description: From truffles to cheeses and steaks to seafood, the providers of ingredients that go into everything from a pasta al tartufo to soup are confronting an existential crisis.
item.title: Unsold truffles tell tale of broken $5 trillion food chain

item.description: The blame game for the Dragons' dire start to the season shouldn't start and end with the coach. Halfback Ben Hunt is also in the gun, says Mark Carroll.
item.title: 'No one gets picked for Origin from reserve grade': Carroll's fears for Hunt

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Authorities have cordoned off a sinkhole that opened up in Melbourne's CBD overnight.
item.title: Sinkhole opens up in Melbourne CBD
